sect2.title: Mounting Additional Kernel Filesystems
sect2.para: Mount the proper virtual (kernel) file systems on the newly-created directories:

screen.userinput: mount -vt devpts -o gid=&gid-tty;,mode=620 none /dev/pts mount -vt tmpfs none /dev/shm

sect2.para: The mount commands executed above may result in the following warning message:

screen.computeroutput: can't open /etc/fstab: No such file or directory.

sect2.para: This file—/etc/fstab—has not been created yet, but is also not required for the file systems to be properly mounted. The warning can be safely ignored.
